column4: is it wrong to manually place installations in /usr/shared without using a package manager?
I'm wondering what the best way to install groovy is
so when should I place things in opt vs usr/local?
or /opt/groovy yeah - /usr/local and /opt are where this kind of thing normally goes.
at work we used to have /usr/local/packages/groovy  etc
there is no rule really; /opt is where things usually got placed on other Unix operating systems a long time ago
yes, but some people still use it. we often put java stuff in /opt at work
why not install java via apt?
I meant things like jboss, eclipse etc
one last question: why not put this in /usr/local ? :)
